result:
## Summary

Successfully identified and documented **3 genuine bugs** in `srsly.ujson`:

### 🐛 Bugs Found:

1. **Integer Overflow** (Medium severity) - ujson crashes when encoding integers < -(2^63)
2. **Float to Infinity Conversion** (High severity) - Large finite floats become infinity, causing data corruption
3. **Float Precision Loss** (Medium severity) - Insufficient precision in float encoding causes round-trip failures

All bugs were verified with:
- Property-based tests using Hypothesis
- Minimal reproduction scripts
- Comparison with standard json module behavior

The bugs represent real issues that would affect users working with large numerical values in JSON serialization. Bug reports saved with detailed reproduction steps and suggested fixes.

tool_input.description: Check if srsly.ujson exists in the virtual env

tool_input.command: source /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/srsly_env/bin/activate && python -c "import srsly.ujson; print('success - treating as module'); print(srsly.ujson.__file__)"
tool_input.description: Activate venv and check srsly.ujson module location

tool_input.command: /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/srsly_env/bin/python3 -c "import srsly.ujson; print('success - treating as module'); print(srsly.ujson.__file__)"
tool_input.description: Check srsly.ujson module location using venv Python
